properties.areaDesc: Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; South Laramie Range; Snowy Range
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 2:18AM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 8 inches. For the Snowy and Sierra Madre
Ranges...15 to 20 inches of new snowfall possible. Visibility
reduced under a half mile in snow and blowing snow. Winds could
gust as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Snowy...Sierra Madre and south Laramie Ranges. Goshen
County in southeast Wyoming.

* WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
